content: below is a sketch of the different components of a sawgaw floof and how they will fit together not showing the belly as that is not visible on a side view all components put next to one another head floofs make 2 of these start with the wing colour r1 mc with 6 single_crochet r2 6 increase 12 r3 1 increase 1 single_crochet x 6 18 r4 1 increase 2 single_crochet x 6 24 r5 1 increase 3 single_crochet x 6 30 r6 1 increase 9 single_crochet x 3 33 r7 1 increase 10 single_crochet x 3 36 r8 1 increase 11 single_crochet x 3 39 r9 39 single_crochet 39 fo body floofs make 2 of these start with the wing colour r1 mc with 6 single_crochet r2 6 increase 12 r3 1 increase 1 single_crochet x 6 18 r4 1 increase 2 single_crochet x 6 24 r5 1 increase 3 single_crochet x 6 30 r6 1 increase 4 single_crochet x 6 36 r7 1 increase 5 single_crochet x 6 42 r8 1 increase 6 single_crochet x 6 48 r9 1 increase 7 single_crochet x 6 54 r10 1 increase 17 single_crochet x 3 57 r11 1 increase 18 single_crochet x 3 60 r12 1 increase 19 single_crochet x 3 63 r13 1 increase 20 single_crochet x 3 66 r14 single_crochet all around 66 fo feet make 2 of these start with the accent colour r1 mc with 3 single_crochet r2 3 increase 6 r3 1 increase 1 single_crochet x 3 9 r4 1 increase 2 single_crochet x 3 12 r5 1 increase 3 single_crochet x 3 15 r6 1 increase 4 single_crochet x 3 18 r7 1 increase 5 single_crochet x 3 21 fo beak start with the accent colour start by making a third foot we will use this as the base for the beak do not fasten_off at the end of the foot beyond the foot the beak is not worked in the round r8 turn 16 single_crochet r9 turn decrease 12 single_crochet decrease r10 turn decrease 10 single_crochet decrease r11 turn decrease 8 single_crochet decrease r12 turn decrease 6 single_crochet decrease r13 turn decrease 4sc decrease r14 turn decrease 2sc decrease r15 turn 2 decrease r16 turn decrease fo tail start with the accent colour r1 mc with 3 single_crochet 3 r2 3 increase 6 r3 6 single_crochet 6 r4 1 increase 1 single_crochet x 3 9 r5 9 single_crochet 9 r6 1 increase 2 single_crochet x 3 12 r7 1 increase 3 single_crochet x 3 15 r8 15 single_crochet r9 1 increase 4 single_crochet x 3 18 r10 1 increase 5 single_crochet x 3 21 r11 21 single_crochet 21 fo belly start with the belly colour note this piece is not worked in the round start from one side of the tail attach the different colour yarn and get started r1 9sc 7sc per side of the four-sided pyramid so start 1 single_crochet ahead of one side then do that whole side and one more
